key_clauses.name: Definition of Confidential Information
key_clauses.summary: Includes all technical, business, and financial information disclosed by either party
key_clauses.original_text: "Confidential Information" means any information disclosed by either party to the other party, directly or indirectly, in writing, orally or by inspection of tangible objects...

key_clauses.name: Non-Disclosure Obligation
key_clauses.summary: Receiving party must protect confidential information with same degree of care as own confidential information
key_clauses.original_text: The Receiving Party agrees to hold and maintain the Confidential Information in strict confidence using the same degree of care that the Receiving Party uses to protect its own confidential information...

key_clauses.name: Permitted Disclosures
key_clauses.summary: May disclose to employees and contractors with need-to-know who are bound by confidentiality
key_clauses.original_text: The Receiving Party may disclose Confidential Information only to its employees, agents, or contractors who have a need to know such information...

key_clauses.name: Return of Materials
key_clauses.summary: Must return or destroy all confidential materials upon termination or request
key_clauses.original_text: Upon termination of this Agreement or upon request by the Disclosing Party, the Receiving Party shall use reasonable efforts to return or destroy all Confidential Information...

key_clauses.name: Non-Solicitation
key_clauses.summary: 2-year restriction on soliciting employees of the other party
key_clauses.original_text: During the term of this Agreement and for a period of two (2) years thereafter, neither party shall directly or indirectly solicit for employment any employee of the other party...

party_a: Clearly mark confidential information as confidential
Provide written notice of any required legal disclosure
Cooperate in seeking protective orders when applicable
party_b: Protect confidential information with appropriate care
Limit disclosure to authorized personnel only
Return or destroy materials upon termination

conditions: 30 days written notice by either party
termination.consequences: Confidentiality obligations survive for 3 years after termination

confidentiality.scope: All technical, business, financial, and strategic information
exceptions: Information in public domain (not through breach)
Information already known prior to disclosure
Information received from third party without restriction

dispute_resolution.governing_law: Laws of the State of Delaware
